manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Optimal Liposomal Vitamin C by Seeking health provides 1000 mg of vitamin C in a great tasting liquid form. Our vitamin C liposomal liquid supports your immune system.* Each serving supports the body’s natural neutralization of free radicals. The liposomal vitamin C drops support the body’s natural response to histamine and supports healthy inflammatory responses.* Optimal Liposomal Vitamin C helps your immune system with collagen production, a healthy immune system, and cellular energy.* The liposomal vitamin C drops provide a unique liposomal delivery method to support maximum absorption of our high-potency vitamin C. Our liposomes are composed of non-hydrogenated phospholipids derived from GMO-free sunflower oil to allow for optimal absorption across cell membranes.* Seeking Health’s Vitamin C Liposomal liquid provides a high-potency dose of antioxidant vitamin C to optimize your body’s natural defense systems.* Please do not freeze the liposomes to allow for maximum potency and bioavailability.

1000 mg of Vitamin C Soy-free liposomal format may help support optimal nutrient absorption*High-potency dose of antioxidant vitamin CMay help support a healthy immune system*May help support healthy eyes and skin*

Formulated by Dr. Ben Lynch Dr. Ben Lynch and Seeking Health provide supplements because we believe in order to remain healthy in our toxic, high stress environment, one must supplement with pure, well-formulated nutrients. We are here to see you get better and then stay better. Our true passion is prevention. If we can prevent disease through educating you and others how to build and maintain a solid foundation, then we’ve accomplished our goal. Welcome to Seeking Health.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tasty way to get your C!
reviews.reviewText: After doing a mind-numbing amount of research on the benefits of vitamins and their role in good health, slowing down the effects of aging, skin health, chronic disease prevention, and energy, I've concluded Vitamin C is in the top five if not #1 spot of critical supplements we need to be ingesting daily. I can't possibly put all of the benefits in this review, but urge you to do some research on C and all of the amazing things it does. Next up, I began to research the most bioavailable forms of C, with the goal of saturating my cells with C on an ongoing basis. Liposomal is the way to go. The next task, can I get this incredible vitamin in a bioavailable form, without extra junk, and still have it taste good? Yes. Yes. Yes. In fact, this particular brand is so yummy to me, I could easily go overboard with it. One thing to remember is your body can only absorb about 250-500mg at a time, and studies show cell saturation begins to drop in about five hours, so the best way to take it is about 1/2 tsp every four hours. This totals 4 doses (assuming you sleep for eight hours of your day) and gives you the 2,000 mg daily which was Linus Pauling's recommended daily dosage for the average, healthy individual. If you suffer from particular diseases, you can and should safely take more. The really nice thing about this form, is it bypasses the digestive system which means high doses will not cause tummy upset or the "big D" and your body can immediately begin utilizing it. I wish it weren't so expensive, but with vitamins as with most things, you get what you pay for. Love this stuff!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite Vitamin C!
reviews.reviewText: I am very much into health, and love reading up and understanding various vitamins and benefits of supplements, specficailly in relaiton to my skin and keeping myself as youthful as possible. Some of the many benefits of vitamin c include: promoting collagen, healing of scar tissue, slowing down the rate of free radicals, and keeping wrinkles, dryness and fine lines at bay. Among other things, it creates strong nails and hair.I recommend anyone who is very into fitness and health to follow Chris Kresser. There are various forms of vitamin c you can take, but he writes how liposomal is the "best" form and most absorbed in the body without other added crap. I normally just squeeze some in a spoon and take it with water, it taste like orange-sickle pop, and I find it pretty yummy. My skin glows when I take it consistently and I believe it contributes to my better mood and higher energy levels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I have been taking high-dose (14,000mg daily) vitamin C for 26 years. I publish cforyourself.com about vitamin C. This newer liposomal form of vitamin C is astonishing. Due to our system's lost ability to make vitamin C from glucose, our need for vitamin C must be satisfied by what we eat. Unfortunately, our digestive system does not do particularly well using vitamin C from our diets, especially when we are trying to get enough to promote optimum health. Enter liposomal/lypo-spheric vitamin C. These versions allow much more utilization of the vitamin C you take. This is more than just needing to take less. Much of the water-soluble vitamin C we take, especially at higher doses, goes through our systems causing diarrhea-like symptoms. This is not desirable.These non-water soluble forms fix this problem. So much so that they allow much more vitamin C to get into our systems. This can make a huge difference for therapeutic purposes. Personally, I have found this to be amazing. If I start to feel some congestion, I can take 2,000mg of this or the Livon Labs Lypo-spheric C that comes as goo in a packet and my symptoms are gone in 1/2 an hour. If they come back, repeat.This has wide-ranging implications for illnesses, such as cancer, that can oftentimes benefit from very high doses of C, higher than we can get from regular vitamin C.I gave this five stars but I have to tell you that it is not delicious. I found that mixing it with a little orange juice works well, but it still has a slight plastic feel to it and "lemon zest" makes it sound much tastier than it is. A very small price to pay for the results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Great product.Why the smaller bottle and same price??

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ... that the liposomal form of vitamin C might be better absorbed than standard supplements of that vitamin
reviews.reviewText: Having read in some research that the liposomal form of vitamin C might be better absorbed than standard supplements of that vitamin, I decided to try this Seeking Health brand of liposomal vitamin C. It's a liquid that doesn't taste bad at all, and I have no hesitancy in taking it from this reliable manufacturer. Previously, I had taken vitamin C in supplement form, and often skipped taking it. (I have problems with taking too many capsules or caplets at a time, and already take many supplements.) I do think that vitamin C is one of the more important vitamins to make sure you have in your system.You keep this product refrigerated and take it on an empty stomach; I've mostly taken mine early in the morning. Although I need to use some costly digestive enzymes to even hope to properly digest any noticeable amount of food, this Optimal Liposomal Vitamin C doesn't need any enzymes to tolerate - absolutely no unwanted symptoms for me! I wish it were not so expensive, but I'm planning to keep taking it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I could tell a difference by the second day
reviews.reviewText: I think this is the real deal. I could tell a difference in my energy level by the second day. Also I think it may be helping with joint pain and inflammation. It is worth the cost to me until I learn how to make it myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to take
reviews.reviewText: I've been taking lypo-spheric vitamin C for the past 2 months which I have to pour out of a packet and into something liquid to take. This, however, I can take straight out of the bottle using a spoon. The lemon taste is real lemon--it is sour, but it masks the awful taste of the liposomal vitamin itself very well.The only question I had was whether I need to keep it in the fridge after opening. My bottle doesn't say. To be on the safe side, I'm keeping mine refrigerated.I would recommend this product to others. It is the easiest form of liposomal Vitamin C to take that I've found.
